title: Gunfire near Nationals Park leaves two injured
text:
Two people were shot and wounded in separate incidents late Saturday in a Southwest Washington neighborhood a few blocks west of Nationals Park, D.C. police said.

At about 11:15 p.m., police said, officers were sent to the 1400 block of Half Street SW, where “multiple gunshots” had been heard. At the scene, officers found a damaged vehicle and shell casings on the ground.

The vehicle was parked and unoccupied, police said.

Shortly afterward, police said, a man who had been shot showed up at a Washington-area hospital. Police said the man told officers that he had been where the gunfire was reported.

However, police said, the man “did not provide any further information.”

His wound was not life-threatening, police said.

Meanwhile, police said that about five minutes after officers began investigating the Half Street shots, a gunshot was heard a few blocks away, near the 200 block of N Street SW.

There, officers found someone who had a bullet wound in his hand.

He was taken to a hospital for additional treatment. Police said he did not provide a useful description of anyone who might have shot him.

Police on Sunday said that they did not think the two incidents were related.

They said both are being investigated.

The area of the first shooting is about a quarter of a mile west of Nationals Park. A game between the Miami Marlins and the Washington Nationals was played at the park Saturday night, but concluded about two hours before the gunfire in the neighborhood.

description: Police said the two shooting incidents in SW Washington were apparently unrelated.
